comments.text: The bus is leaving around 3pm, the driver goes to the petrol station just before, I just asked him if it can let me go in for free, he was ok with that.
I hitched the night bus all the way to Santa Cruz, 16 hours of dirt road, by talking to the bus driver at the petrol station just before the bus station.

Spot for hitching north towards Santa Cruz. Petrol station and Customs Office nearby, where many truckers do they paper work. You can get here from Yacuiba, from the first plaza after crossing the border. The mini bus has the name Pajoso displayed on the windshield.
A new road to Potosi. Not far from Uyuni there is pay toll, wher everybody must stop.

First car passing by stopped for me. Traffic is low in general, I was lucky I'd say. You also bypass the entrance fee of 100Bs as they don't stop private cars at the gate. (If they ever stop, I've not seen anyone there)
Take a micro (van) from Av. Aniceto Arce towards  Tutimayu until last stop on this road. Price is 4Bs (November 2024)
Perfect spot at this intersection. There is a speedbump so they need to slow down. A private car took us to uyuni. (2 people)
We went to this toll station with a collectivo (no.18) and then a truck took us some minutes later (2 people)
We were asking at the toll station to go to Oruro. Lots of trucks. A private car took us
Quickly got the 2nd truck. We needed to get through the blockades and got with this truck throughone by a desvío (2 people)
We only waited a short time. A truck took us. (2 people)

There's a toll station, always good bc all the trucks need to slow down
(2 people) not a lot of traffic
Went in the morning like 9am

Chatted with the toll dude and he helped us getting a truck
(2 people)
Ask the toll people if they can help you. We found a truck with the kindest driver ever (2 people)
Like another review mentioned, at this spot are the vegetable trucks. Just be kind and ask. We got a hitch at 8pm to samaipata (2 people)

Around 4-5pm, there are the trucks full of vegetables going straight to Cochabamba. I hitched one, it´s a 9 hours adventure on the top of the truck with Quechua farmer. The driver didn´t want me to come because he said that it will be too tough for me. Just insist a little. Also  think that you will travel at night, at 3400m, it can be really cold, every farmer has at least 8 cover on them.
Toll at the end of the city. Every single car who go further than few km stop to pay the fee. Good time to ask.
People are talking about this road by "km", just asked every open window at the traffic light which km they were going. Keep doing this until km 22 where the toll is.
Following the avenida Grigota, 4th or 5th ring, there is a massive corner where you get a 78 secondes traffic light in your direction.
Is that the place of the toll? I guess no. It could be useful to know where it is.
I went with another friend to Samaipata and the "ruta del che". just heading to the toll, and wait a while. I hitched a ride on a truck after 30 min.
There is a toll where all the cars must stop, shortly after the crossroad leading to the airport.
Salida a Copacabana.

Exit towards Copacabana.
There a lots of cars and tracks of this direction.
Went early in the morning to get the big trucks. (2 people)
I got a lift directly to Sorata from here.
Spot where all the micro stops. There is plenty of space to stop, and a shop sellings snacks and drinks by a lovely women.
A crossroad with traffic slowing down.
There is a border crossing station with reasonably friendly staff but very little traffic so You may be waiting for days, literally. I was much more lucky.
After the curve in front of the gas station. Not the best spot because they just about to speed up but it worked. A private car took us to Montero. (2 people)
Standing there (m and f) for quite a while but a private PKW took us all the way to cocha

We were not able to catch a ride here. Because of the political situation and a lack of petrol there was very few traffic. We were waiting over 4 hours and gave it up. 4 other locals tried to get a ride here too at the same time, so if you go hitchhiking, this might be the spot - direction Chile
